Posted By: j_mindfingerpainter (3/31/2012 9:04:21 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I once had one of these bad boys in the triple digits.  
  
I was in a ten person multiplayer where everybody had a range of 1 and I was playing my 120+ card R/G/B deck I like to call Munchy. I had a [doubling season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=doubling season) out, dropped a [mycoloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mycoloth) nomming 4 creature tokens getting 16 +1/+1 counters. Next turn I made 32 saproling tokens, top-decked and dropped another Doubling Season followed by a 132/132 Ulasht, the Hate Seed. I did not win that game, but it was darn fun.  
As a side note, I do not run tutors in that deck and it's MOSTLY singleton spells. To find a single doubling season in it is difficult, finding 2 is just a miracle.
posts.html:
I once had one of these bad boys in the triple digits.

I was in a ten person multiplayer where everybody had a range of 1 and I was playing my 120+ card R/G/B deck I like to call Munchy. I had a doubling season out, dropped a mycoloth nomming 4 creature tokens getting 16 +1/+1 counters. Next turn I made 32 saproling tokens, top-decked and dropped another Doubling Season followed by a 132/132 Ulasht, the Hate Seed. I did not win that game, but it was darn fun.
As a side note, I do not run tutors in that deck and it's MOSTLY singleton spells. To find a single doubling season in it is difficult, finding 2 is just a miracle.

posts.post_content:
Daikoru, this is much better than Yavimaya Kavu, because:  
  
2/1/2006 Creatures that are both red and green provide two +1/+1 counters.  
  
So if your first 3 turns are [Wild Cantor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wild Cantor)/[Scab-Clan Mauler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scab-Clan Mauler)/[Burning-Tree Shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burning-Tree Shaman), this guy comes in on turn 4 as a 6/6.
posts.html:
Daikoru, this is much better than Yavimaya Kavu, because:

2/1/2006 Creatures that are both red and green provide two +1/+1 counters.

So if your first 3 turns are Wild Cantor/Scab-Clan Mauler/Burning-Tree Shaman, this guy comes in on turn 4 as a 6/6.

Posted By: WhiteWizard42 (8/11/2011 9:31:16 PM)

posts.post_content:
I like the card (including the art). Sadly it's a bit weak. It should count itself, so it comes basically with two counters into play.  
It's best if you can give it persist, like with cauldron of souls. Then you just give it persist each turn, turn all it's counters into creatures, and when it persists back to play it's even larger. ^^
